cause.description:
*Despite claiming more lives than any other cancer, lung cancer receives comparatively little research funding.
*Approximately $1,723 per lung cancer death was spent in 2004 on research, compared with: $13,953 for breast cancer $10,318 for prostate cancer $ 4,618 for colorectal cancer
*The Department of Defense does NOT FUND research for lung cancer, but funds research for breast, ovarian and prostate cancers, even though the former is the nation’s leading primary cancer killer.
*78 percent of doctors feel that society perceives lung cancer to be a self-inflicted disease, and that if we could remove this stigma, a majority believe patients would be more encouraged to see their doctor
-Information Gathered from lungcancer.org
1. The stigma that goes along with a lung cancer diagnosis MUST be changed.
2. NOBODY deserves to be diagnosed with lung cancer, whether they smoke or not!
3. More Americans die each year from lung cancer than from Breast, Prostate, and Colorectal cancers COMBINED.
cause.mission: To inform the general public about the risks and consequences of smoking while raising money to benefit Lung Cancer Research & Education
cause.name: Support Lung Cancer Research & Education
